text.div: No narrative is provided for definitional resources. A human-readable rendering can be found in the implementation guide(s) where this resource is used.

description.value: An important function of the rectum in particular is the temporary storage and excretion of feces, at the moment there is cause to do so. Disrupting the bowel functions can lead to fecal incontinence and constipation.

purpose.value: This Observation resource represents the Dutch [zib ('Zorginformatiebouwsteen', i.e. Health and Care Information Model) BowelFunction v3.1.1 (2020)](https://zibs.nl/wiki/BowelFunction-v3.1.1(2020EN)).

comment.value:
Please note that on a functional level, zib BowelFunction references zib MedicalDevice, but in FHIR this direction is reversed. Therefore, the concept IncontinenceMaterial (NL-CM:4.15.6) is mapped on `DeviceUseStatement.reasonReference` in profile [zib-MedicalDevice](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-MedicalDevice) instead of in this profile.
Several concept(s) of zib BowelFunction are represented using distinct Observation resources. These are grouped using the current resource and are referenced on `Observation.hasMember`:
* FecalContinence (NL-CM:4.15.2): [zib-BowelFunction.FecalContinence](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-BowelFunction.FecalContinence) * Frequency (NL-CM:4.15.4): [zib-BowelFunction.Frequency](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-BowelFunction.Frequency) * DefecationConsistency(NL-CM:4.15.9): [zib-BowelFunction.DefecationConsistency](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-BowelFunction.DefecationConsistency) * DefecationColor(NL-CM:4.15.10): [zib-BowelFunction.DefecationColor](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-BowelFunction.DefecationColor)

definition.value: Stoma describes the presence of an unnatural, surgically created opening. If the patient has a stoma, the type of stoma must be entered along with the date on and location at which the stoma and any stoma pouches were placed. A comment can also be entered.
